Question
========
A researcher conducted a study on the effects of different ways of presenting information on "remembering important information. The following ways of presenting information were used in this study: 1. Powerpoint presentation with text only. 2. Powerpoint presentation with text and images. 3. An animation with sound. The "remembering of important information" was measured afterwards with a multiple-choice test with 16 questions. In addition, relevant background information about the study participants was collected, namely:
- prior knowledge,
- intelligence.

Which analysis technique is most suitable to check whether presentation of information has an effect on 'remembering important information', taking into account the participants' prior knowledge and intelligence?

Answerlist
----------
* One-way ANOVA.
* Multi-way ANOVA.
* One-way ANCOVA.
* Multi-way ANCOVA.
